name: Brocard's conjecture
rephrased: Between the squares of consecutive prime numbers, there are at least four prime numbers.
implication_form: If n is at least 2, then there are at least four primes between the squares of the nth and (n+1)th prime.
explained: Brocard's conjecture states that for any integer n â‰¥ 2, where pn is the n-th prime number, there are at least four prime numbers strictly between the squares of pn and the square of the next prime, pn+1.
